result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael M. Beasley-Hart was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: THE DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS SHALL DEDUCT RESTITUTION AND ALL OTHER COURT OBLIGATIONS AT THE RATE OF 25% OF ALL MONIES RECEIVED WHILE INCARCERATED.

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay restitution in the amount of $22,378.06 and restitution surcharge.
--------------------------------------
*AMENDMENT 1/10/2019 - Judgment of Conviction amended, Court orders that all payments are to go to victim first until paid in full and then any remaining payments may go to the Crime Victim Compensation fund. 
---------------------------------------

Pay court costs and Department of Corrections Supervision fees.   If the defendant is discharged from Extended Supervision with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.
------------------------------------

No contact with victim. No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
------------------------------------

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.   Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge. 
------------------------------------

records.addlTxt: Court's response on Memo from DOC Filed 5/2/19 - "Ok, noted. We will see by next 4 months review." PAK
Memo from DOC re: payments
Court orders deft to pay $120 per paycheck towards restitution.

11:32 am  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
ADA Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant Michael M. Beasley-Hart appeared.  
Probation Agent Janilee Wolff appears on behalf of Dept. of Corrections.  
Matter is before the Court for a Probation Review Hearing.  
This was scheduled because of non-payment of restitution.  
Atty Johnson makes record with regard to victim notification.  She didn't believe they intended to appear.  They did send a letter to the State.  
11:34 am  Atty Wolff makes record as to payments made by defendant.  Deft has agreed to a wage assignment and he has turned it into his employer.  Deft owes 19,638.73 in restitution - 14,346.32 is to the victim specifically; $5,531.74 is to the crime victim compensation fund.  Deft has paid $170 since sentencing;  
11:37 am  Response by Mr. Beasley-Hart.  Deft says he needed to go to prison - it was a reality check for him.  Deft responds to letter of victims.  Deft has offered to pay $100 per month toward restitution.  He did provide all of his bills to his Agent.  He is making net pay of $730.  His monthly rent is $635; Utilities are about $145 and owes $145 right now;  He earns $15 per hour.  He wants to be consistent and pay this back to the victim.  Deft is single.  He assists his girlfriend with her child.  11:43 am  Response by Atty Johnson.  11:44 am  Deft will pay $200 today.  11:45 am  Statement by Atty Wolff that the only concerns expressed to her was a drinking violation.  She has not received any violation reports from Illinois.  Court asks if DOC wants deft confined until firearms violation is investigation?  Deft says his parole officer came over to his house and he didn't have any firearms.  Further response by Atty Wolff.  Deft is on probation period on his job.  11:48 am  Court orders that the victim gets paid first - before crime victim compensation - JOC TO BE AMENDED.  11:49 am  Deft really wants to make the payments and keep his job.  11:49 am  Court orders deft pay $120 every paycheck.  Atty Wolff states deft can make the payment to the DOC office.  Court would like an update from DOC every 4 months.  11:51 am  Court in recess.
Probation review hearing on January 4, 2019 at 11:30 am.
Memo from DOC re: PRH 1/4/19
PRH response from victim

Order Denying Motion for Sentence Modification

Court in session at 10:00 a.m. Defendant Michael M. Beasley-Hart in court, in custody via video from Racine Correctional with attorney Carl William Chesshir.  Andrew Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter on for Motion to Modify Sentence. Attorney Chesshir makes statement regarding eligibility on CIP. Brief Argument by Attorney Andrew Herrmann.  Court makes statement regarding defendants Motion and doesn't find new factors in CIP/ERP. Motion denied. Atty Chesshir to prepare Order. 
Court in recess 10:11 pm.

10:20 am  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
ADA Andrew Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Attorney Carl William Chesshir appeared.   Mr. Beasley-Hart is not present in Court today.  
This is on today for a Motion to Modify sentence.  
Court asks if counsel prepared a Writ to produce Mr. Beasley-Hart for today's hearing.  He indicates it was not.  Court could have him appear by video but would need time to make the arrangements.  Attorney Chesshir would have no objection to Mr. Beasley Hart's appearance by video.  Court continues Motion hearing to Monday, April 24th at 2:00 pm.  Court's clerk will attempt to set up a video appearance for Monday.  The defendant is at Racine Correctional.  
10:22 am  Court in recess.  Motion hearing scheduled for April 24, 2017 at 02:00 pm.
State's Answer to Defendant's Motion to Modify Sentence

IT IS ORDERED that the time for filing a notice of intent to pursue postconviction relief under WIS. STAT. RULE 809.30(2)(b), is extended to August 25, 2016.  
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the time for the State Public Defender to act under WIS. STAT. RULE 809.30(2)(e), is extended and shall commence as of the date of this order.  
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that in the event the defendant does not seek representation form the State Public Defender, or is denied representation by the State Public Defender, the time for the defendant to act under WIS. STAT. RULE 809.30(2)(f), is extended and shall commence as of the date of this order.
